result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Laurice M. Golla was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay fines, costs, and surcharges. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Submit DNA Sample.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Comply with other counseling/assessments deemed appropriate by the agent.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations BAC: .138 - Agent can accept the DOT Assessment if appropriate.

timeConds.notes:
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow.
Ability to do 1/2 half of the sentence on electronic home monitoring, if qualify after the assessment.
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 30 days.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Laurice M. Golla in court with attorney Alex J Hewett. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-412 and 15TR-3050.

10:39 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Address is verified.

There is a plea agreement.

15CF-412: Defendant is pleading to Count 1. Count 2 will be dismissed.
15TR-3050: Defendant will plead to amended speeding citation.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Atty Hewett concurs.
Defendant concurs. 

Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY 15CF-412: Count 1
Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY 15TR-3050

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Hewett for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-412: Count 1: Found Guilty OWI 5th offense
15CF-412: Count 2: Dismissed
15TR-3050: Amended to Speeding 1-10 MPH over

Defendant acknowledges prior OWI convictions.

This is a felony matter, Court could order a PSI.
State does not request a PSI.
Defendant does not request a PSI.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Court reviews the evaluation from the pretrial supervision program.
Atty Hewett makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court appreciates the Defendant for recognizing the severity of the offense.

Court believes the plea agreement is fair and appropriate.

BY THE COURT:
15CF-412:
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 36 Months
Drivers License Revoked 36 Months
IID 36 Months
DOT Assessment and comply with safety plan BAC: .138
Conditions of Probation:
Jail sentence for 180 Days
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow
Ability to do 1/2 half of the sentence on electronic home monitoring if qualify after the assessment
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 30 days
Pay a fine of $1,200 plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Blood draw fee of $26.45
Submit DNA Sample
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations BAC: .138 - Agent can accept the DOT Assessment if appropriate
Comply with other counseling/assessments deemed appropriate by the agent

15TR-3050:
Speed amended down to 1-10 MPH over
Pay a fine and costs totaling $175.30, 3 points
60 days to pay or set up payment plan

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.
15TR3050 to follow.

3:08 p.m. Defendant Laurice M. Golla in court with attorney Alex J Hewett. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing on 15CF412.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Laurice M. Golla in court with attorney Alex J Hewett. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond and conditions of bond are continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Laurice M. Golla in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:15 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Court questions defendant. 
Defendant states she received paperwork from the public defender. 
Court questions Public Defender Representation. 
Public Defender Representative indicates she was denied and sent the petition but not the evaluation showing the denial. 

BY THE COURT:  Court will continue the matter for 2 weeks.   Bond Continued. 

  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
